summary: Guernsey is the second-largest island in the Channel Islands, located west of Normandy, France. It is part of the Bailiwick of Guernsey, which includes five other inhabited islands and has a population of about 64,000. Historically, Guernsey was part of the Duchy of Normandy but became loyal to the English crown in 1204. It was occupied by Nazi Germany during World War II and liberated in 1945. Today, Guernsey is a self-governing dependency of the British Crown. Its largest industries are financial services, tourism, and agriculture. The island's culture is a mix of British, Norman, and French influences.
title: Guernsey
